title.native: ジャングルはいつもハレのちグゥ
title.romaji: Jungle wa Itsumo Hare nochi Guu

description:
Haré was a happy boy living out his days in the jungle with his mother, but then one day Guu showed up and became a member of their household. Throughout the series he faces many hardships as he tries to keep Guu out of trouble in the jungle.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Jungle wa Itsumo Hale Nochi Guu

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Ojou-sama
tags.description: Features a wealthy, high-class, oftentimes stuck up and demanding female character.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

title.native: ジャングルはいつもハレのちグゥ　デラックス
ジャングルはいつもハレのちグゥ
映像特典 ~幻のパイロットフィルム~

node.description: **Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

Frequents on [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/)' projects, but is freelance.

Was inspired to become an animator after having seen [Ninku](https://anilist.co/anime/912/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/関口可奈味)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/), currently affilaited with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).
Seiichi Kyouda is a Japanese musician, composer and arranger.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/sawadamasayo)

Masayo Sawada, better known by her stagename Sister MAYO, is a Japanese singer. She is a member of the Columbia Music Entertainment duo [Cyber Nation Network](https://anilist.co/staff/345379/Cyber-Nation-Network), and a vocalist in Project.R which performs many theme songs for the Super Sentai series, some have reached the top ten in Oricon's charts. Her best-known songs as a soloist have been the opening theme of [Haré+Guu](https://anilist.co/anime/253/HarGuu/) and the ending theme of Mahou Sentai Magiranger. She is the younger sister of heavy metal musician Taiji, with whom she was in the rock band Otokaze.

Yoshimoto Yumi is a lyricist, novelist and essayist born in Tokyo, Japan. She graduated from Seijo University's English Language Department and debuted in June 1984. Yoshimoto is married and has a daughter.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/magicmagico) He joined Okayasu Promotion after graduating and studied there as editor, he collected experience on tv animation and drama and gave his debut on Ninja Hattori. He is currently working for 1000 Yamakoshi. Not to be confused with the other Toshihiko Kojima whose name is written with different Kanji.

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/). Close friends with [Masahiro Andou](https://anilist.co/staff/101518/).

_Note: Not to be confused with the [other animator](https://anilist.co/staff/222513/) or the [art director](https://anilist.co/staff/219445/)._
Started off as a production manager at Ad Cosmo.
